intro: Boltonia laevigata, commonly known as smooth coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features tall, sturdy stems that can grow up to 6 feet in height, adorned with large, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped, gray-green leaves that are smooth to the touch, giving it its common name. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Boltonia laevigata is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
